definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: A Braavosi trading galley called at Pentos on her way back from the Jade Sea.
sentences.chinese: 一艘布拉佛斯商船在从翡翠海的归途中在潘托斯休整。

sentences.english: In the home of Webmaster Nan Tian Ma's friend, we had the lunch break.
sentences.chinese: 我们在南版主的吊家湾朋友家午餐休整。

sentences.english: We had a beautiful lunch and luxury lunch break of more than one hour.
sentences.chinese: 大家吃喝得珍珍有味，豪华地休整了一个多钟头。

sentences.english: He is a provocative man who takes nothing whatever for granted.
sentences.chinese: 他是位爱争论的人，无论休整都不愿想当然。

sentences.english: ZBrush plugins will be updated for ZBrush 3 and released when available.
sentences.chinese: 这些插件将在休整好之后被更新和发布。

sentences.english: We could revise the Epistemic Accuracy Theory to get around this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以休整这条认知准确性的来绕过这个问题。

sentences.english: Last week, the callback is a break or short-term rebound in the end?
sentences.chinese: 上周的回调是短期的休整还是反弹的结束？
这就是“爱情空窗休整期”。

sentences.english: On Sunday we rested, cleaned up, reflected.
sentences.chinese: 星期天我们休整一天，打扫卫生，还小结了一下。

sentences.english: Take a pause and catch up.
According to Commander Tang's arrangement, we had lunch and toke a rest here before we went further.
sentences.chinese: 根据司令的安排，我们就在这里午饭休整了。

definition: to spruce up/to renovate/to tend (a garden)/to groom (one's hair)/to finish (a rough surface)/to trim (a lawn)/to touch up (a photo)
to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to drill troops/to build up and train
to set out on a journey
to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]
